wikipedia_page.main: Kevin Morrice Stewart (born 3 June 1968) is a Scottish National Party (SNP) politician serving as Minister for Mental Wellbeing and Social Care since 2021 and as the Member of the Scottish Parliament (MSP) for Aberdeen Central since 2011. He previously served as Minister for Local Government, Housing and Planning from 2016 to 2021.

link_mentions.page: North East Scotland (Scottish Parliament electoral region)

response: For elections to the House of Commons in the Parliament of the United Kingdom, Old Aberdeen forms part of the Aberdeen North constituency. The current Member of Parliament (MP) for Aberdeen North is Kirsty Blackman. For elections to the Scottish Parliament, it elects a constituency member as part of the Aberdeen Central constituency. The current Member of the Scottish Parliament for Aberdeen Central is Kevin Stewart.http://www.oldaberdeen.org.uk/page6.html
The seat has been held by Kevin Stewart of the Scottish National Party since the 2011 Scottish Parliament election.

link_mentions.page: Cabinet Secretary for Health and Social Care
response: The Cabinet Secretary is assisted by the Minister for Public Health, Women's Health and Sport, Maree Todd and Minister for Mental Wellbeing and Social Care, Kevin Stewart.

link_mentions.page: List of gay, lesbian or bisexual people: Sj–Sz

response: His election to the position of Depute Provost drew both praise and criticism, due to his young age.  His older sister, Kirsty Blackman (born 1986) is also a SNP politician, elected as councillor for the Hilton/Stockethill area in 2007 and as MP for Aberdeen North in 2015. West masterminded Kevin Stewart's election as Aberdeen Central MSP in May 2011.
